info.name: School of Reawakening
info.description: The School of Reawakening from Dark Arts Player’s Companion
info.author: Jonoman3000

description.p: As a member of the school of reawakening, you combine the forces of necromancy with the power of conjuration. By transforming the necromantic energies of the creatures you kill into completely new conjurations, you bridge the gap between these two school of magic, creating a hybrid school that combines elements of both Conjuration and Necromancy. As you progress, you learn to shape together ever more powerful conjurations.

sheet.description: By transforming the necromantic energies of the creatures you kill into completely new conjurations, you create a hybrid school that combines elements of both Conjuration and Necromancy.

description.p: Beginning when you select this school at 2nd level, the time you must spend to copy a necromancy or conjuration spell into your spellbook is halved.

sheet.description: The time you must spend to copy a necromancy or conjuration spell into your spellbook is halved.

description.p: At 2nd level, you gain the ability to store a creature’s soul for later use. You gain a Soul Vial, which can be used to store the soul of a creature with a challenge rating as high as 1/2. By using a 10 minute ritual on a creature that has died within the last hour, you can store that creature’s soul in the vial. If there is already a soul within the vial, then the new soul replaces it.

Once you have a soul contained within your Soul Vial, you can release it to reform that creature. The creature has the same statistics as the creature you gathered the soul from, but it appears slightly translucent and visibly magical. Once formed, the creature lasts for up to 1 hour, and requires your concentration to maintain. The creature is friendly to you and your companions, and obeys your spoken commands (no action required by you). If you don’t issue any commands to it, it defends itself from hostile creatures, but otherwise takes no actions. Once the duration ends, the creature’s soul is freed and the vial is emptied.
Once you form a creature, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.
Starting at 6th level, you can capture the soul of a creature with a CR as high as your wizard level divided by 3, rounded down.

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, the creatures you create through your Reawaken Soul feature can be used as arcane explosives. When one of the creatures is reduced to zero hit points, it explodes in a burst of necrotic essence.

Each creature of your choice within a 10 ft radius of the exploding creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d6 necrotic damage for every point of that creature’s CR. Creatures below CR 1 deal 1d6 necrotic damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage.

sheet.description: When a creature created with Reawaken Soul dies, each creature of your choice within a 10-foot-radius of that creature must make a DC {{volatile-soul:dc}} Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 necrotic damage per point of that creature's CR. Creatures below CR 1 deal 1d6 necrotic damage. Half damage on success.

description.p: Starting at 10th level, you can consume the soul within your Soul Vial to restore hitpoints to yourself. As an action, you may drink the contents of the vial, regaining 2d4 hit points for every point of that creature’s CR. This feature cannot restore hitpoints to a creature other than yourself.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

sheet.description: Consume the soul in your Soul Vial to regain 2d4 HP per CR point of the creature within it. This feature can only heal you.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, the creature created through your Reawaken Soul feature lasts for up to 8 hours, and no longer requires concentration to maintain.
